sources.data_found: NSF Award Abstract #2320290 (Red Cluster): 'The system will consist of... 4 GPU nodes each with quad NVIDIA A100 80GB GPUs.'
Graduate Catalog: Lists Computer Science, M.S. Does not list a Computer Science Ph.D. program.

student_data.notes: Exact enrollment headcounts not published on department pages. Estimates derived from Common Data Set 2023-2024 degrees awarded data. Undergrad: ~17 degrees awarded/year * 4.5 years = ~77 majors. Grad (MS): ~25 degrees awarded/year * 2 years = ~50 students. USD does not offer a specific Ph.D. in Computer Science (though students may research CS topics under Physics/Materials Ph.D. tracks, they are not counted here). [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

gpu_resources.notes: Red Cluster (NSF Award 2320290, deployment 2024): 4 nodes * 4 A100 80GB = 16 A100s. Lawrence Cluster (Legacy): 3 nodes * 2 V100 = 6 V100s.

analysis_notes: USD is a smaller research institution. Primary compute resource is transitioning from 'Lawrence' (V100s) to 'Red' (A100s, funded by NSF OAC-2320290). Student counts are estimated from degree completion data in the 2023-24 Common Data Set as live enrollment dashboards are not public.
